dialogue.raw_text: He'll blow her goddamn head off.

dialogue.raw_text: One of  em's in the slam.

dialogue.raw_text: Damn you, Cates ... Get in here.

dialogue.raw_text: Jack, come on, there is an official department policy about cop killings. Cop killers represent a special priority because any man crazy enough to kill a cop is a greater threat to an unarmed civilian... In other words, we can't seen like we're in the revenge business... I know, we all know the truth's a little different.

dialogue.raw_text: You might be more of a team player and a little less of a hot dog on this one, Jack.

dialogue.raw_text: Being a hot dog's worked pretty well for me so far... Besides, I got a lead...

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.  You're not a team player. You gotta do things your own way. Fine.  Nail this guy and make us all look good.  But you better watch your ass.  If you screw up, I can promise you, you're goin' down.

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.  I'm not like you. I'm not gonna sit on my ass wondering what's right and what's wrong... There's a psycho out there killing people with my gun and I'm gonna get him.  Because it's my job. And if you don't get that...

direction.raw_text: He walks down the cell block. Inmates stare at him from inside the stark cells. They don't know who he is, but they can smell a cop. Cates stops at Twenty-two, looks inside... a bit startled. Obviously, Reggie Hammond has connections and taste. The paint is fresh; there's framed prints on the wall instead of pin-ups, and the overall feeling is that of a graduate school dorm rather than a prison. Cates turns, nods to the Guard at the end of the cell block. He throws a switch and the door opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cates steps inside. Hammond is at a table wearing a Sony Walkman and writing in some detailed ledgers with a fountain pen. He's boogeying in his seat to the music. Sprawled on a bunk nearby is LEROY, another black inmate close to Hammond's age. Leroy is leafing through a copy of a skin magazine. He doesn't even look at Cates.

direction.raw_text: No answer. Cates leans over, hits the override button on the Sony.

direction.raw_text: He tosses the Walkman to Leroy who dutifully puts it on.

direction.raw_text: Cates takes the forensic photo out of his pocket, passes it across the table to Hammond.  He looks at it, hardly reacts.

Cates' breathing becomes more labored. His windmill attack penetrates Cates' defense. Cates clears his head, charges, bull-like ... His rush and greater bulk send both of them crashing into some trash cans and a brick wall. Hammond is faster... Cates is much stronger; Both men on their knees. They look at one another. Silently, they move to their feet. Hammond's back is to a wall... Cates keeps him there, negates the lighter man's agility. They slug away, each now arm-weary... Exchange a dozen blows. Finally, Cates steps back, arms at his side... Breath coming like a bellows... Hammond has to hold on to the wall; one more punch would put him out.

direction.raw_text: Ganz runs, turns out of an alley onto a street baked with neon light. Cates pursues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hammond runs out, turns down the adjoining street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Following Ganz, holding him in sight, but unable to get a shot off...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hammond running down a street near the one where Ganz is being chased...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cates fires at Ganz ... Ganz ducks in a doorway...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on his street hears the shot... he runs toward it, down a narrow alley between two buildings....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ganz hears footsteps approach from the opposite direction of Cates.  They move very close to where be is crouched... it is Hammond coming toward him... Ganz suddenly rolls a garbage can in his path, dropping him like a stone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Comes toward where he expects to find Ganz... Ganz has his arm around Hammond's throat and his gun to his ear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hammond drops his gun.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Drop it... you come up against me, you're gonna lose...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Hey, cop, come on...l got something for ya... come on...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cates comes out of the doorway from which he's fired...and comes into the middle of the street, gun up ... he puts it down when he sees Ganz with Hammond in jeopardy.  The hand that's around Hammond's throat also holds the black bag. Cates walks forward, his gun down at his side...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cates still walking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are now closer to each other. Ganz holding Hammond and the money...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cates keeps the same methodical pace...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, he crouches and fires twice. Hammond twists as Ganz also fires. Ganz is hit in the collarbone and driven ten feet backward. His grip on Hammond drops, Hammond dives to the ground, looks at Cates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ganz' gun still in his hand, but his arm useless at his side. Cates is frozen in the crouch, ready to fire again. Ganz is in enormous pain holding his bleeding chest... A look of childish disbelief passes over his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He runs at Cates full-speed, screaming, roaring, then is stopped by two more bullets that tear fist-sized holes in his chest. Cates rises from his crouch. Takes his gun out of Ganz' now lifeless hand. Then goes over to Hammond...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cates raises the pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hammond smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cates smiles back, picks up the black bag as they move off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: After I get outta this, cop...I'm gonna live forever...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think you're gonna make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whaddya mean...I got your gun ... I got his money... I got everything...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give up.  He's crazy.  He'll kill us both.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He won't try it. He's a fucking chickenshit cop. They're all fucking wimps, right, Cates?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Okay, cop ... give me your gun and I'll let him live. Come on, Cates, you're real good at giving up your gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus Christ, I didn't think you'd really do it. You are crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got hit.  I can't believe it. I got shot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're done.  End of story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ain't gonna beg for my life. It ain't cool.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yours?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mine...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) You okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.  But I wasn't there for a second.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did pick a real strange time to go and be brave all on your own...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just tryin' to get the money, Jack.  Just tryin' to build up a few points on that merit system.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cates in the tub, steam rushing from the water. Elaine sits on the porcelain edge as he splashes and soaps...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches out, lifts his watch from his pile of clothes on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elaine smiles, leans close.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How'd they take it back at headquarters?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Usual bullshit.  You make one smart move and everybody wants to be your friend... You know somethin', shootin' guys sucks. Especially compared to this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been waiting a long time to hear you say that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, bein' a hard-ass all the time is a real drag, but it works.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Three more hours...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Promised I'd turn my back while he... ah, never mind...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's takin' care of the same business I'll be takin' care of - soon as I dry off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're impossible...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what I always say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Minimal crummy hotel room accommodations... Hammond is kissing her at the door, finishing buttoning all his buttons. He reaches for a wallet, gives her several bills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They kiss... it's pretty romantic... She opens the door for him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here you go, baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, don't do that.  I said I wasn't a pro, remember?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, no, I'm tryin' to be nice. Buy yourself something pretty. I'd do it, but I got to go.  I got this cop waitin' for me...
dialogue.name: dialogue
